explanation: The incorrect line was c.sort() â€” it sorted all N nicknames. The problem requires taking the top K participants (the first K input names) and then printing those in lexicographical order. I changed that single line to first keep only the first b entries and then sort them (c=c[:b]; c.sort()), so only the top K names are sorted. This fixes the logic without modifying other lines.
fixed_code:
a,b=map(int,input().split())
c=[]
for i in range(a):
    c.append(str(input()))
c=c[:b]; c.sort()
c=c[0:b]
for i in c:
  print(i)
